ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Creative thinking, Critical thinking, Understanding of American Culture
This course helped me to develop my critical thinking, speaking, and writing.

how to write executive summary
practiced English speaking and writing skills
using issue map tools to analyze complex topic

We learned about the process of academic discussion and presentation in English. We learned about American culture, learned about the current situation and history of the United States, and improved our horizon.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: Lots of opportunities to participate in discussions or presentations because there were five students.

Weakness: Lack of opportunities to hear the various opinions of more students because there were five students.
MY strengths are speaking and my weaknesses are writing. I improved my speaking and writing skills and also my critical thinking skills

Strengths: Professor is super patient to multinational students
Weaknesses: The pace of the course could be faster
could be improved: the course structure can be more related to English and it's better to give some after-class reading homeworks

In every class, we all have a chance to express our views, and the teacher was always encouraging students to make progress and tried to make students comfortable in her class. We all appreciate her kindness.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I, as a former teacher in my country, would recommend this course to other students and other teachers.
Yes, it is the best way to meet with international people and learn from others and improve your skills highlighting critical thinking skills.
This class provides a free and confident environment for you to improve your English without pressure
Yes, I think it's a friendly course for international students. This course gives students the opportunity to exchange ideas with people from different cultural backgrounds and ages.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments:
I am sure I can make the most use of what I have learned in this course when I get back to my job of teaching students in my country in the near future. The knowledge and skills I have learned will also help correct my stereotypes and improve the way of research. 

Finally, I thank Yale University and Professor Rosenblum, Betsy for the opportunity to take this Yale Summer Session course.
The teacher explained to us how to think critically, and introduced specific steps and methods, which I think are feasible.

extras.title: SUMR S016E 01 - English for Academic Purposes
